{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3075498,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T15:37:54.874Z","cooked":"

Does anyone know of a zip tie/cable tie tool that actually flush cuts after it pulls them tight? I picked up a couple off the 'Zon and they leave nasty sharp ends sticking out. Uncool.

Seconded, great for making zipties tight and flush. We don’t use them for wire management zipties as they get to tight for that purpose.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T15:46:05.643Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":465,"readers_count":464,"score":108.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":413880,"topic_slug":"zip-tie-tool","display_username":"Cory Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":3782,"username":"JamesCH95","name":"JamesCH95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jamesch95/{size}/1200_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22243,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/zip-tie-tool/413880/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3075503,"name":"JCharlton","username":"JCharlton","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jcharlton/{size}/110702_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T15:56:41.874Z","cooked":"

I was lucky enough to find a Thomas & Betts ERG50 cheap second hand. Fantastic tool, can’t recommend it enough.

I was unlucky enough to lose it at a field set-up in Montreal, so if it turns up in a road case in Manchester could someone hold it for me?

Automation Direct sells them. Almost all of them are adjustable to get the tension correct for the zip tie you are using. I would not count on any of them leaving baby smooth cuts.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T16:53:10.242Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":388,"readers_count":387,"score":87.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":413880,"topic_slug":"zip-tie-tool","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.automationdirect.com/adc/shopping/catalog/wiring_solutions/cable_ties/cable_tie_tools/pin.003","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":52}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/zip-tie-tool/413880/5","custom_user_title":"2974 Robot Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3075507,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T17:06:33.971Z","cooked":"

The one from AD looks like the one I got off Amazon that left a pretty long and sharp tail… Have you used that model before?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T17:06:33.971Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":360,"readers_count":359,"score":82.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":413880,"topic_slug":"zip-tie-tool","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/zip-tie-tool/413880/6","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3075515,"name":"FrankJ","username":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T18:52:45.903Z","cooked":"

I have a handful of zip tie guns from different sources. I have at least a couple from AD. They run together so I don’t really remember which is which. My experience is that it is more about the tension adjustment than the gun. Too high tends to stretch the tail leaving a sharp edge.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T18:52:45.903Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":304,"readers_count":303,"score":65.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":413880,"topic_slug":"zip-tie-tool","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":46443,"username":"Weldingrod1","name":"Rod","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/zip-tie-tool/413880/7","custom_user_title":"2974 Robot Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3075516,"name":"Troy Dietz","username":"troy_dietz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/troy_dietz/{size}/135768_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T18:59:13.625Z","cooked":"

Afaik it’s inherent to the design. Tried close to a dozen guns and they’ll all get your wrist.

The real zip tie gun is some decent needlenose and hakko CHP-170.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T18:59:13.625Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":283,"readers_count":282,"score":111.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":413880,"topic_slug":"zip-tie-tool","display_username":"Troy Dietz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"❤️ conflict-free COTS"},"post_url":"/t/zip-tie-tool/413880/8","custom_user_title":"❤️ conflict-free COTS","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3075543,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T21:47:19.273Z","cooked":"

We just pull by hand and then hit them with flush cutters. I think ours is McMaster 3621A36. Not hard at all to get a zip tie head that’s smoother than a Cadillac on a freshly-paved highway.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-08-02T21:47:19.273Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":248,"readers_count":247,"score":119.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":413880,"topic_slug":"zip-tie-tool","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.mcmaster.com/3621A36","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":33}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/zip-tie-tool/413880/9","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3075551,"name":"RedLeader342","username":"RedLeader342","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/redleader342/{size}/174347_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-02T22:16:01.700Z","cooked":"

We also do this but with a spare pair of snap on flush cuts because i was in nascar and wanted to be bougie with my tools lol

Pull and flush cut is our current state of the art. Just hoping there is another level out there

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2022-08-03T03:01:53.076Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":220,"readers_count":219,"score":64.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":413880,"topic_slug":"zip-tie-tool","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/zip-tie-tool/413880/11","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3075635,"name":"Carter Steggerda","username":"steggs85","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/90ced4/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-08-03T13:45:04.972Z","cooked":"

I just use these, and instead of cutting it parallel with the cutters, I cut it perpendicular (but still flush against the zip tie) and it tends to not be sharp.

amazon.com

BOENFU Wire Cutters Zip Tie Cutters Micro Flush Cutter 2 Pack 5 Inch Precision...

BOENFU Wire Cutters Zip Tie Cutters Micro Flush Cutter 2 Pack 5 Inch Precision Wire Clippers Hobby Snips Small Side Cutting Pliers for Jewelry Making, Electronics | Black - - Amazon.com

Can you post a photo of this?

The professional quality Hakko flush cutters are pretty inexpensive. I gave up on trying to save one or two dollars on off-brand ones because the cutting jaws never lined up properly.

amazon.com

Hakko CHP Micro Cutter, Clean Cut, 16 AWG (set of 5): Solder Insertion...

Hakko CHP Micro Cutter, Clean Cut, 16 AWG (set of 5): Solder Insertion Extraction Tools: Amazon.com: Tools & Home Improvement

And… test data! On the right is a $20 Amazon tool. Middle is the cheap McMaster tool. Left is the expensive McMaster tool, a Thomas&Betts ERG50. Middle and left I’d call an actual flush cut!! Right, not so much.

Another round of zip-tie shootout. The gold standard is stegg85’s method on the right.

image1401×1031 220 KB

Top view of the cuts:
image1414×956 243 KB

And the contenders Cheap-O off Amazon, CK 95003 from McMaster, Panduit GS2B, and Ty-Rap ERG50. The CK is the cheapest that does a solid job. The Panduits are available on Fleabay for $40-50. NOTE: the tension is important for function! If you have the tension set way too low for your zip-tie, you will get a sticking out end even with the Ty-Rap tool! It really needs to pull, stretch, cut, and allow snap back.
image1421×1017 438 KB

Gratuitous detail shot of the working bits of the Panduit. Note the tiny, sharp, single bevel blade in it. A little grinding on the end could improve its trimming performance further.
image1070×815 206 KB
